title: I hate the jungle exp nerf.
body:
I'm someone who's always enjoyed power farming. That said, why the hell did they make jungle exp worthless? The logic behind the change made absolutely no sense too. Riot basically said, "we don't like level 2 gankers, so instead of nerfing them specifically we're going to make junglers have less of an impact." Like, what?! Why? Just... why?
{{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}

replies.body: This is the most questionable nerf to LoL I've ever seen in my life. It did not fix ANY of the problems with jungle. They still impact the game more than any other role simply by picking one lane and perma ganking it. The only difference is that going into the mid stages of the game they're not going to be as relevant? But that was never really an issue to begin with. I never saw a fed Lee Sin and think, damn, if only he was a level lower this game would have been won! The only thing it did was completely butcher farming junglers who were almost non existent anyway,

> This is the most questionable nerf to LoL I've ever seen in my life. 

This is not the first time Riot has nerfed jungle exp actually.. Nor even the second I think :P

Far from, but all the other times it was because Junglers were getting further ahead in levels than their laners, which Riot never wanted. Every other time it was to tackle exp being a legitimate problem. This time it was for something completely unrelated.

And this was Riot's attempt to control level 2 gankers, wasn't it?{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}
Riot needs to learn how to solve problems...

I love to play {{champion:104}} , {{champion:35}} , and {{champion:30}} - but the jungle exp and gold nerfs make it so much harder play these champs. It feels like they can't scale fast enough to be relevant most of the time (with some leniency for Karthus with his ult since you get free Dark Harvest stacks). Graves is the worst case of this. Takes you around 25mins of powerfarming and picking up a few kills/assists to get {{item:1412}}  + {{item:3071}} + {{item:3046}} + {{item:3006}}, which is when you start to have impact on the game. With how fast-paced games are now, the outcome is usually decided by then. 

Shaco can't gank at all well until level 5 when he gets his 3rd point in Q, putting him behind most meta junglers from the start of the game since they are able to be active earlier than Shaco. You're forced to farm for items to be relevant while already behind from the start. 

Karthus starts to "fall off" in a way due to lack of reliable income once the camp scaling slows down/stops. Your income slows down enough that it seriously prolongs his late-game scaling, causing a sort of "fall off". Unless you have at least built up or can build up Dark Harvest stacks - usually through your ult, which has about a 3 minute cooldown - it doesn't look so great. Kind of like {{champion:56}}, your first ult is usually pretty important and if you fuck it up, you fall behind more often than not. 

I like having different playstyles available to me while playing jungle, but it just feels like it's often more effort than it's worth to play anything besides highly-proactive junglers.

Like shouldnt it be the other way around lol

As a laner main, I feel like every single changes Riot make to jungle just make junglers even more impactful on our games even if the intention was to make them less important. This escalated with time and failures to the point that a good jungler can basically fuck up the games of every single 4 enemy laners just by existing.

I'm a fan of it now honestly, even if I wasn't before. I've never felt so accomplished keeping track of the enemy jungler, and being able to deny them a lot of exp and gold from stealing their opposite camps when they gank. I've actually been invading more and more since that change, and I'm enjoying the role of jungle way more. I feel like I've actively gotten better at jungling, because being able to keep track of the enemy jungler so I can steal their stuff, is actively keeping me a higher level than them. 

This is what I think people are missing. The changes weren't meant to stop level 2 gankers. People with good ganks, are always going to gank early. What it does, is allow them to be easily punished for early ganks, by denying them gold and exp that they would've gotten *alongside* the kill they maybe got while ganking. And if they didn't get the kill, then you've already hurt their ability to affect the game. 

On all the Diamond videos I've watched, on how to be a better jungler, one of the core things has been paying attention to the enemy jungler's clear routes, and position on the map because he's your rival, your lane opponent without a lane. The same way laners manipulate the waves to deny CS and exp, you should be doing the same with the enemy jungler. You don't deserve just to have a nice safe place to afk farm so you can eventually emerge out the jungle to win the game, while effectively ignoring everyone else. 

League is not a PvE game, if you want to power farm, you need to start invading, and actively punishing the enemy jungler for wanting to gank lanes. This is how you stay relevant in levels to laners. I know, because this is what I've been doing differently. It doesn't even need to be that much, a chicken camp, gromp, or depending on the jungler, you can steal their opposite buff while they're still clearing theirs or Scuttle (might want to ask teammates to ward your own though.)

Effectively, all that is just a long complicated way of saying 'git gud', but I think that folk like you have the wrong impression about the jungle. It's not a place to just farm gold and exp, the enemy's jungle is as much your playground as your own is. Win the game, by denying your enemy jungler the gold and exp they need, while keeping yourself ahead of them.
